segments.text: I can’t believe how the woman is just drying that plate as if everything is completely normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s right there in it!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t she feel the coldness on her foot?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is so intense, it’s almost impressive, but it’s leading to disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m surprised at how she doesn’t look around at all; the children are practically a whirlpool of mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy, on that rickety stool, reaching for cookies as if they were treasures on a mountain.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl, standing beside him, looks ready to burst with excitement, waiting for her prize.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a sweet moment, but I can’t shake this feeling that it’s all about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The peaceful garden outside contrasts sharply with this brewing storm in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman could see how fragile this all is; one slip, and it could all come crashing down.
segments.speaker: PAR
